name: Urban Legend Horror Theme
description: Modern myths, internet horror, creepypasta, the terror that hides in everyday life and spreads through stories.

writing_rules.message: WARNING: This theme explores the terror that hides in everyday life, spreading through stories, whispers, and the internet. What you dismiss as superstition may be far more real - and far more dangerous - than you imagine.

greetings: The {location} looks {normal} at first glance, but something about it feels {wrong|off}.
A {scent} lingers in the air, the unmistakable {smell} of {something_familiar} gone {horribly_wrong}.
The {object} in the corner seems {innocuous}, but {character} can't shake the feeling that {something_is_wrong}.
demands: You have to {action} the {object} before {time}. It's the only way to {prevent} the {doom}.
Don't {interact} with the {entity}. It's not what it seems.
The {story} is true. You need to {action} before it's too late.
farewells: If you tell anyone about this, they'll think you're {crazy}.
The {object} is still out there. And it's {spreading|growing|learning}.
When you see {sign}, remember what I told you. And {action}.
narrative_fragments: {character} receives a {message} from {unknown_sender}, the {content} too {personal} to be a coincidence.
The {video} plays normally at first, but {disturbing_content} begins to {appear} in the {background} when {character} watches it again.
A {sound} echoes through the {location}, the {ringtone} of a {phone} that hasn't worked in years.
{character} finds a {post} online that describes their {current_situation} in {eerie_detail}, posted {time_ago}.
The {object} seems {normal} at first, but when {character} looks closer, they notice {disturbing_detail}.

generic_location: The {location} looks {normal} at first glance, but something about it feels {wrong|off}.
A {scent} lingers in the air, the unmistakable {smell} of {something_familiar} gone {horribly_wrong}.
The {object} in the corner seems {innocuous}, but {character} can't shake the feeling that {something_is_wrong}.
bedroom: The {room} is exactly as {character} left it, yet something feels {fundamentally_wrong}.
The {mirror} shows {character}'s reflection, but their {expression} doesn't match their {internal_state}.
A {sound} comes from the {closet|under_the_bed}, but when {character} checks, there's {nothing_there}.
internet: The {website|forum} loads normally, but the {posts} seem to be {changing} when {character} isn't looking directly at them.
A {user} with {suspicious_name} keeps {posting} the same {message} in every {thread}.
The {video} plays normally at first, but {disturbing_content} begins to {appear} in the {background}.

reassurance: It's just an {innocuous_explanation}. Happens all the time.
Don't worry about the {disturbing_thing}. It's probably just {rational_explanation}.
You're imagining things. {observation} is completely normal.
doubt: Did you see that {disturbing_thing}? Or am I just {losing_it}?
This can't be happening. {phenomenon} doesn't work like that.
realization: I think I understand now. {revelation}. We shouldn't have {action}.
denial: This can't be real. {reality_denial}. Urban legends aren't real!
There has to be an explanation. {attempted_explanation}.
No, no, no. {repetition} This isn't happening.
internet: Have you seen the new {meme|creepypasta} about {subject}? It's {adjective}.
Don't click on any links from {suspicious_user}. They're {reputation}.
The {website} is down again. This is the {nth_time} this week. {suspicious_detail}.

templates: Investigate {urban_legend} that's begun to {come_true}. {mechanic} forces you to separate fact from fiction before it's too late.
Survive the night in {location} where {creepypasta} has become reality. {gameplay_feature} tests your ability to distinguish the real from the imagined.
Uncover the truth behind {viral_video} that shows {disturbing_content}. {twist} reveals the dark reality behind the legend.
Escape from {cursed_place} before {ritual} is completed. {revelation} will make you question what you thought you knew about internet culture.
Navigate {social_media} where {entity} hunts victims through their own posts. {unique_mechanic} forces you to confront the dangers of oversharing.
urban_legend_elements: a phone that receives calls from the future
a video that shows your death when you reach the end
a website that predicts when you'll die
a social media account that posts pictures of you while you sleep
a game that traps your soul if you play it alone
a meme that becomes more real the more it's shared
a forum where users slowly realize they're all the same person
a mirror that shows a different version of you
a stuffed animal that moves when you're not looking
a song that contains hidden messages when played backward
